engine_status: V2 CYCLE 2 COMPLETE -- EXPANDED SCOPE. Added physical production/manufacturing/robotics landscape alongside deepened services analysis. 42 signals scanned across 8 categories. 32 business models constructed across 18 verified opportunities. 5 Tier 1 (was 4), 5 Tier 2 (was 4), 6 Tier 3 (was 5). NEW: Physical/production landscape mapped for the first time. Capital allocation rotation to hard-tech confirmed.

tier_1.structural_shift: SMB Accounting/Finance -- Baumol Cure + Jevons Expansion (DEEPENED)

business_models.name: AI-First Full-Service SMB Accounting (Service Layer)
Fractional AI CFO for Growth SMBs
AI Tax for US-LATAM Cross-Border

tier_1.key_signals: 75% CPAs retiring. 70% SMBs unserved. Tool layer crowding (Puzzle, Zeni, Booking.ai) but service/full-service layer STILL SPARSE. AB 1175 modernizes CA CPA licensing (Jan 2027). Intuit Christensen dilemma: AI cannibalizes CPA Live. Counter-signal: tool saturation means must differentiate on full-service delivery.
tier_1.cycle_2_updates: Competitive scan reveals tool layer saturation but sparse service layer. CA AB 1175 lowers CPA acquisition cost. Counter-signals analyzed -- clarify rather than weaken opportunity. Score adjusted -1 (tool crowding) but thesis strengthened at service layer.
barriers: Intuit tool-layer competition (avoid -- build at service layer)
next_steps: Build MVP full-service bookkeeping (not another tool)
Acquire/partner 1-2 small CPA practices in CA
Target the unserved 70% first (no switching friction)
Spanish version for LATAM

tier_1.structural_shift: Healthcare Admin AI -- CMS WISeR Regulatory Tailwind + Largest Baumol Cure

business_models.name: AI Healthcare Admin for Independent Practices (Revenue Cycle + Prior Auth)
AI Prior Authorization Processor (WISeR-aligned)
business_models.target: Payers in WISeR states (NJ, OH, OK, TX, AZ, WA) + expansion

business_models.name: AI Clinical Capacity Multiplier for Nursing

tier_1.key_signals: CMS WISeR model: AI-powered prior auth in 6 states starting Jan 2026. Waystar $1.25B Iodine acquisition. 92% leaders prioritizing AI in RCM. HIPAA Security Rule first major update in 20 years. OpenAI/Hathr.ai offering HIPAA-compliant infrastructure. 250+ state AI healthcare bills. Counter-signal: incumbents investing heavily but selling enterprise, not serving independent practices.
tier_1.cycle_2_updates: CMS WISeR model is MASSIVE regulatory tailwind -- government officially endorsing AI in healthcare admin. HIPAA compliance infrastructure commoditizing (OpenAI, BastionGPT, Hathr.ai). Counter-signals (Waystar $1.25B acquisition) analyzed: incumbents are sustaining innovation at enterprise level, disruptive opportunity remains at independent practice level. Score +1.
barriers: HIPAA compliance (commoditizing -- moat shifting to EHR integration)
next_steps: Start with admin (claims/prior auth/coding) NOT clinical
Use HIPAA-compliant platforms (Hathr.ai or OpenAI for Healthcare) to reduce infra cost
Pilot in WISeR states first (TX, AZ for geographic fit)
Target independent practices ignored by Waystar/R1

tier_1.structural_shift: Robotics x AI Manufacturing Acquisition & Modernization (NEW)

business_models.name: Acquire-and-Modernize: Distressed Custom/Batch Manufacturer
business_models.target: Retiring-owner or PE-distressed custom manufacturers (CNC, fabrication, specialty parts)
business_models.price_point: Variable by product line; 30-50% margin improvement post-modernization
business_models.capital_structure: SBA 504 ($5.5M at below-market, FY2026 fees waived) + equipment financing (80-100% LTV) + state incentives
business_models.production_fit: STRONG -- custom fabrication, small-batch, variable products with high labor % and QC requirements

business_models.name: Manufacturing AI Integration Service (help others modernize)
business_models.cost_advantage: Service model: charge 10-20% of cost savings achieved
business_models.target: SME manufacturers (500-5000 employees) with readiness gap

tier_1.key_signals: 542K robots installed 2024 (doubled in 10 years). SBA 504 fees waived for manufacturers through FY2026. 2.34M boomer-owned businesses approaching retirement. Cobots $25-60K with 8-14mo ROI. 98% manufacturers exploring AI, only 20% prepared. Manufacturing PMI output rising while employment at 6-month low (automation divergence). IFR: 1-week installation times, SME expansion. BlackRock overweight industrials.
barriers: Integration complexity (moat -- few can do it well)
moats: Equipment + permits + customer contracts from acquisition
next_steps: Screen BizBuySell/LoopNet for retiring-owner manufacturers in CA/West Coast
Focus on custom fabrication, specialty parts, or batch food production
Model SBA 504 + equipment financing capital stack for $5-8M total entry
Build relationship with 2-3 CDCs for SBA 504 origination
Identify cobot integrators for modernization partners

tier_1.structural_shift: Insurance Claims AI -- Sparse Competition + Regulatory Moat Forming

business_models.name: AI Claims Processing for TPAs and Mid-Market Insurers
AI Claims for LATAM Insurance Market

tier_1.key_signals: Total AI claims startup funding <$20M for $40B+ market. Avallon $4.6M, Elysian $6M, Amera seed. 23 states adopted NAIC AI Bulletin. Model law expected 2026. 46 states require TPA licensing. LATAM insurtech 536 companies, $199M funding (+117% YoY). Insurance AI spend +25% in 2026.
tier_1.cycle_2_updates: Competitive density confirmed extremely sparse. Elysian $6M seed is largest AI claims round -- minuscule vs market size. NAIC model law creates regulatory moat timeline. LATAM data shows 536 insurtechs but tech enablers (claims, fraud) only 51% -- room for AI-native claims processor. Score unchanged.
moats: First-mover on NAIC AI model law compliance
next_steps: Pilot with 2-3 TPAs on auto/property claims (simpler)
5-state compliance first (start with friendliest regulators)
Build multimodal claims intake (photo + document + voice)
LATAM version (Spanish) for cross-border expansion

tier_1.structural_shift: AI-First Legal Services -- SMB Disruptive Play (DEEPENED)

business_models.name: AI-First Law Firm for SMB Corporate Legal
AI Legal Platform for Solo/Small Firms

tier_1.key_signals: Harvey at $8B valuation (Series F) but sells TO BigLaw (sustaining innovation). Legora $1.8B. SMB market unserved. A&O Shearman first BigLaw to deploy Harvey to all 3,500 employees. BUT: no one building AI-first law firm for SMBs. Christensen distinction clear: Harvey sustaining, SMB AI firm disruptive.
tier_1.cycle_2_updates: Harvey's $8B+ valuation confirms structural force strength. Counter-signal analyzed: Harvey is sustaining innovation for incumbents, not disruptive. SMB service gap persists. Score unchanged.
next_steps: CA bar licensing pathway
Contract review + drafting MVP for SMBs
Partner with 2-3 licensed attorneys
Price test at $500-1500/month with 20 SMBs

business_models.name: Acquire-and-Modernize: Specialty Food/Beverage Producer
business_models.production_fit: BEST FIT -- variable products, quality-sensitive, high labor %, strong brand differentiation

business_models.name: AI-Powered Craft Food Production Platform (RaaS for food)

tier_2.key_signals: Food automation $12.64B growing to $20.35B by 2031 (8.26% CAGR). Cobots for high-mix packaging, AI QC vision, batch optimization. RaaS emerging. CES 2026 dominated by food/beverage AI. USDA VAPG $200K grants available. SBA 504 fee waiver for manufacturers.
next_steps: Screen BizBuySell for retiring specialty food/beverage producers in CA
Model USDA VAPG + SBA 504 capital stack
Identify cobot packaging + AI QC integration partners
Research Davis CA local food production ecosystem

tier_2.structural_shift: PE Distress Cascade -- Minsky Moment Deepening

business_models.name: Distressed Professional Services Acquirer
AI-First Staffing Platform (PE distressed)

tier_2.key_signals: Chapter 11 at decade high. PE-backed 30% of filings. Distress rate +148% since 2022. $1.5T+ CRE debt maturing 2026. NAV loans and continuation vehicles = PE sponsors delaying exits. Double squeeze intensifying.
tier_2.cycle_2_updates: PwC confirms continued rise in 2026. Distress rate reached 11.98% in Jan 2026. PE distress applies to BOTH services and manufacturing -- broadens acquisition universe. Score -1 (deal flow access remains barrier).
next_steps: Map distressed firms in CA/West Coast -- both services AND manufacturing
Build broker relationships for deal flow
Prepare AI service platform for acquired practices/plants

tier_2.structural_shift: Precision Agriculture AI + Robotics -- Davis CA Advantage (NEW)

business_models.name: AI-Powered Precision Agriculture Service (Davis CA based)
business_models.production_fit: BEST FIT for specialty crops (variable, quality-sensitive, high-value)

business_models.name: Autonomous Farm Equipment Service (drone + ground robot fleet)

tier_2.key_signals: UC Davis Farm Robotics Challenge 2026. Autonomous farm equipment market $128.4B by 2034. Per-plant AI management commercializing. Davis CA = direct access to ag talent, pilot farms, research partnerships. 15-30% input cost reduction from variable-rate application.
moats: Production optimization data by crop type
next_steps: Connect with UC Davis AIFS program
Interview 10+ Central Valley specialty crop growers
Prototype drone + AI crop monitoring for 2-3 pilot farms
Research USDA grants for precision ag technology

business_models.name: AI Compliance Navigator for SMBs
Sector-Specific AI Compliance (Healthcare + Insurance)

tier_2.key_signals: 47 states + EU AI Act. 250+ healthcare AI bills across 34+ states. Colorado AI Act June 2026. NAIC AI model law expected 2026. First compliant entrant locks out followers. RegTech $18.6B growing 17-36% CAGR.
next_steps: Map all state AI regulations
MVP for healthcare AI compliance
Test with 20 companies

business_models.name: Bilingual AI Business Services for US-LATAM
LATAM Manufacturing AI Integration Service

tier_2.key_signals: LATAM factory automation $19.67B growing to $30.24B by 2031. Mexico export growth 6-6.5%. Reflex Robotics opening humanoid plant in Mexico. Nearshoring driving automation investment. LATAM insurtech 536 companies, +117% funding. Spanish-language founder advantage.
tier_2.cycle_2_updates: Expanded from services-only to include manufacturing integration. LATAM factory automation market is $20B+ and growing fast. Nearshoring creates demand for AI integration services that founders' Spanish + tech skills uniquely serve.
next_steps: Interview 30 US companies nearshoring to Mexico
Price test AI manufacturing integration service
LATAM insurance claims pilot

tier_3.note: Enormous economic force but thin moat in horizontal agent space. Better as vertical-focused strategy.

tier_3.structural_shift: Capital Allocation Signals -- Hard-Tech/Robotics Fund Formation (NEW)
tier_3.note: a16z $1.18B American Dynamism. VC robotics funding $6B+ H1 2025. BlackRock overweight industrials. Not directly investable but VALIDATES physical production thesis. Signals that physical/production AI plays ARE fundable at $5-15M.

tier_3.structural_shift: Skilled Trades AI Operations -- Baumol Premium (CONTINUED)
tier_3.note: Still valid but lower priority than manufacturing + services Tier 1-2 opportunities. ServiceTitan competition remains.

454K worker shortage, Japan/EU leading with automated factories. BUT: capital requirements likely $15M+ for factory. Factory-as-a-Service model (Promise Robotics) could work. Davis CA not ideal location for this. OVER BUDGET THRESHOLD for direct factory but FaaS integration service possible.

tier_3.structural_shift: Low-Wage Baumol Sectors (Home Care, Childcare, Social Work)
tier_3.note: Underexplored territory. Sparse AI competition. But low willingness-to-pay and low tech adoption. Volume play.
Massive Jevons expansion but free competitors (Khan Academy). Best angle: LATAM-first with Spanish advantage.

monitoring.note: Economically viable by 2026 per industry reports but energy costs remain constraint. Monitor for cheap renewable energy areas.
Growing market but niche. Best for high-value, low-volume, complex-geometry products. Watch for cost/speed improvements.

monitoring.shift: LATAM Humanoid Robot Manufacturing (Reflex Robotics Mexico)
monitoring.note: Very early. Monitor for nearshoring-driven demand for automation integration services.

monitoring.shift: Perez Turning Point / AI Funding Correction
monitoring.note: Confirmed signals of installation-to-deployment transition. Digital AI startups failing while physical AI draws capital. Build crash-resilient businesses.

structural_shifts_active.note: Foundational force enabling all other opportunities. Accelerated from 50x/year to 200x/year in 2024-2026.

structural_shifts_active.shift: Baumol Cost Disease Cure (multi-sector -- BOTH vectors)
structural_shifts_active.note: Vector 1: SGA/cognitive services. Vector 2 (NEW): COGS/physical production via robotics x AI.

structural_shifts_active.shift: Robotics x AI Compound Production Cost Compression (NEW)
structural_shifts_active.note: New in cycle 2. IFR data, PMI divergence, cobot adoption all confirm. SBA 504 fee waiver is time-sensitive enabler.
Chapter 11 at decade high. Distress rate +148%. Applies to BOTH services and manufacturing.
Silver Tsunami: 2.34M boomer businesses, $10T transfer. Manufacturing workforce older than national average.
HIPAA update, 250+ state AI bills, NAIC model law, Colorado AI Act. First compliant entrant advantage strengthening.
Expanded to include production: mass customization and craft-at-scale create new demand categories.
a16z American Dynamism, BlackRock overweight industrials, VC robotics $6B+ H1 2025. Physical plays are now 'fundable'.
Expanded from services-only to include LATAM factory automation ($20B+ market).
CES 2026 food/beverage AI innovations. Emanate (a16z) for industrial AI. New categories emerging.
VC shifts toward pragmatism, digital correction, physical capital flows. Build crash-resilient.

barrier_index_summary.note: v2 cycle 2 -- 4 new barriers added (manufacturing integration, food safety, ag seasonality, deal flow). 1 partially resolved (HIPAA infra cost reduced by OpenAI/Hathr.ai). 67% of barriers have moat potential.

v1_vs_v2_comparison.v1_final_state: 11 cycles, 1 PURSUE (Customer Support at 72), 1 INVESTIGATE_FURTHER (Vet at 62), 9 kills, 16 parks, 83% kill/park rate
v1_vs_v2_comparison.v2_cycle_2: 2 cycles, 5 Tier 1, 5 Tier 2, 6 Tier 3 = 16 opportunities mapped, 32 business models constructed, 0 kills. NEW: 6 physical/production opportunities added alongside 10 services opportunities.
v1_vs_v2_comparison.key_difference: v2-2 adds entire physical/production landscape (manufacturing, food, agriculture) that v1 never scanned. v1's Customer Support PURSUE remains valid as Tier 2 in v2. Physical plays unlock new capital structures (SBA 504, equipment financing) and moats (permits, equipment, customer contracts).

cycle_history.note: First v2 landscape mapping cycle. Services-focused.
EXPANDED SCOPE: Added physical production/manufacturing/robotics landscape. 6 new physical opportunities. Capital allocation rotation confirmed. SBA 504 fee waiver time-sensitive.
